body.p: The Web site www.kiplinger.compublished the "Best Values in Public Colleges," saying they were determined by rankings based on data from more than 500 public four-year colleges and universities. Using out-of-state rankings that considered the academic quality, total out-of-state costs, and average costs after financial aid, the 50 best-rated colleges were selected. The boxplot pictured displays the average debt per graduate for these colleges.

image.alt: Boxplot graph of student debt upon graduation

body.p: What percentage of the graduates will have a debt greater than $25,000?

response.feedback: Correct. Since $25,000 is the third quartile (Q3), one-quarter of the graduates will have a debt greater than this amount.

Incorrect. The median, or the value where 50% of the graduates fall above and below, is $21,000. The boxplot indicates that $25,000 is the third quartile (Q3). What percentage of the data fall above Q3?
Incorrect. This is the percentage of graduates who have a debt less than $25,000. What percentage of the data fall above Q3?
Incorrect. The boxplot indicates that $25,000 is the third quartile (Q3). What percentage of the data fall above Q3?
Incorrect. The boxplot indicates that $25,000 is the third quartile (Q3). What percentage of the data fall above Q3?

body.p: 50% of the debts owed are smaller than what amount?

response.feedback: Incorrect. $18,000 is the first quartile (Q1) of the distribution. 25% of the debts are smaller than this amount.
Correct. 50% of the debts are smaller than the median, which according to the boxplot is between 20,000 and 21,000.
Incorrect. Although $22,000 is in the middle of the box, halfway between Q1 and Q3, it is not the median.
Incorrect. $25,000 is the third quartile (Q3) of the distribution. 75% of the debts are smaller than this amount.

body.p: Within which interval of debts would you expect to find the largest number of graduates?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Note that Q1 is 18,000, the median is 20,600, and Q3 is 25,000.
Correct. Since 17,000 is below the first quartile and 21,000 is above the median, more than 25% of the debts are in this interval.
Incorrect. Note that Q1 is 18,000, the median is 20,600, and Q3 is 25,000.
Incorrect. Note that Q1 is 18,000, the median is 20,600, and Q3 is 25,000. Please try again.
Incorrect. Even though the width of the intervals are equal in length, this does not mean they have the same number of observations in them.
